definition: to petition for retirement (old)/to ask for leave to withdraw/to ask to be excused
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue
to retreat/to decline/to move back/to withdraw

sentences.english: At dark impermanent just pardoned to quit of, the apartment door rang to get up.
sentences.chinese: 就在黑无常刚刚告退之时，宿舍门响了起来。

sentences.english: Deputy of Military council has resigned.
Your Majesty, nothing essential happening minister this forgave to quit.
sentences.chinese: 皇上，没什么事情臣这就告退了。

sentences.english: I am afraid you'll have to excuse me for a minute or two.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕您得原谅我暂时告退一会儿。

sentences.english: Sire, do I have your permission to withdraw?
sentences.chinese: 陛下，我是否可以告退了？

sentences.english: In many cases, when you turn in your resignation, you're done.
sentences.chinese: 良多情形下，在你提交了告退书后，你就完了。

sentences.english: I wonder if you'd excuse me for a moment.
sentences.chinese: 不知你是否能恕我暂时告退。

sentences.english: I'm quitting because I want to try something different.
sentences.chinese: 我告退是因为我想尝试纷歧样的工具。

sentences.english: The mice withdrew in great dismay.
sentences.chinese: 老鼠们大为沮丧地告退了。

sentences.english: Edmond excused himself in order to finish docking the ship.
sentences.chinese: 埃德蒙向莫雷尔告退，以便将船停好。

sentences.english: I pleaded fatigue, and excused myself.
At this time her manager came in, quickly she left.
sentences.chinese: 这时候拉拉的经理走了进来，她赶紧告退。

definition: to say goodbye/to take one's leave
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
to follow your orders/to do as you bid
goodbye (modest formula)/Excuse me, I must leave.
to half rise out of one's chair (a polite gesture)
to obey the Emperor's decree/at your Imperial majesty's command
to report on completion of a mission/debriefing
Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
same as 慢慢吃[man4 man4 chi1]
to cup one's hands in obeisance or greeting/(fig.) submissive
